clinical_study.brief_title: Status Epilepticus Unicenter Population (STEP UP) Study
clinical_study.official_title: Status Epilepticus Unicenter Population (STEP UP) Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this observational single-center cohort study is to gain a deeper understanding regarding the effects of treatment adaption based on information from outcome prediction models, risk stratification, as well as treatment monitoring, detection, prevention, and management of complications on course and outcome of adult patients with status epilepticus (SE).

primary_outcome.measure: Data from acute prehospital management by the emergency medical services (EMS)
primary_outcome.description: extracted from the treatment protocols of the EMS

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of ICU (intensive care unit) and hospital stay, and destination at discharge
primary_outcome.description: Duration of ICU (intensive care unit) and hospital stay, and destination at discharge

primary_outcome.measure: Date(s) of seizure(s) captured by electroencephalographic (EEG) data
primary_outcome.description: Date(s) of seizure(s) captured by EEG
withdrawal from anti seizure drugs, structural, infectious, or autoimmune causes

primary_outcome.measure: Number and Duration of SE episodes
primary_outcome.description: Number and Duration (time) of SE episodes

Types of SE according to the current guidelines from the International League of Epilepsy (ILAE) (i.e., nonconvulsive with coma, SE with motor symptoms, focal nonconvulsive SE without coma, and subtle SE
length, level of consciousness at onset, previous epileptic seizures
Critical illness severity scores (e.g., acute physiology and chronic health Evaluation (APACHE II), simplified acute physiology score (SAPS II), sequential organ failure assessment (SOFA), etc.)

Clinical neurologic monitoring scores (e.g., Richmond Agitation-Sedation Scale (RASS) , Seda-tion-Agitation Scale (SAS), Glasgow Coma Score (GCS), Intensive Care Delirium Screening Checklist (ICDSC), Status Epilepticus Severity Score (STESS))
C-Reactive Protein (CRP), albumin, Lactate Dehydrogenase (LDH), Creatin-Kinase (CK), procalcitonin, white blood cell levels, creatinine, liver enzymes, blood gas analyses, metabolic data
in-hospital death, survival, survival with neurofunctional alteration, Glasgow Outcome Score, return to neurofunctional premorbid baseline, readmission

duration, dosage and number of treatment medication, number of antiseizure drugs, invasive procedures, such as intubation, mechanical, ventilation, vasopressors, installation of central lines, nutrition
blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate, oxygen saturation of the blood, body temperature, level of consciousness

intervention.description: Extract data from the digital medical records, the electroencephalographic and microbiologic database.

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients (i.e., patients ≥18 years of age) with diagnosed SE between 2005 and 2018 who have been treated at the University Hospital of Basel.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients (i.e., patients ≥18 years of age) with diagnosed SE between 2005 and 2018 who have been treated at the University Hospital of Basel.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients younger than 18 years.
- Patients with repetitive epileptic seizures not qualifying for SE.
- Patients with documented refusal of the general consent.
